Course Description: PRESENTS BUDGETING, ACCOUNTING AND REPORTING STANDARDS AND PRACTICES FOR GOVERNMENTAL AND OTHER NOT-FOR-PROFIT ENTITIES.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE, STUDENTS ARE ABLE TO:
1.IDENTIFY ACCOUNTING AND REPORTING REQUIREMENTS FOR GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES
2.IDENTIFY SPECIFIC TRANSACTIONS RELATED TO GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES 
3.IDENTIFY ACCOUNTING AND REPORTING REQUIREMENTS FOR NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS 
4.IDENTIFY SPECIFIC TRANSACTIONS RELATED TO NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS 
5.IMPROVE RESEARCH, ORAL AND WRITTEN COMMUNICATION SKILLS
6.REINFORCE ETHICAL AND PROFESSIONAL BUSINESS CONDUCT
Textbook(s):
ACCOUNTING FOR GOVERNMENT AND NONPROFIT ENTITIES, 13TH EDITION
MCGRAW -HILL
WILSON AND KATTELUS
ISBN 0-07-286059-6
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
